title.narrative: Child Protection Training for two Bolivian partners

description.narrative: CAFOD will run with the support of a specialist consultant, a three-day workshop in Cochabamba for two partners (Fundacion Nuna and CENDA) on child protection. The training will sensitise partner staff about the protection of girls, boys, young people and vulnerable adults and their responsibilities. It will highlight the need for institutional safeguards, an institutional policy and the inclusion of this issue in other policies (gender, code of conduct etc) as well as wider discussion about vulnerability. At the end of the training the participants will understand how to undertake their work without putting children at risk, how to recognise signs of abuse; how to manage child protection issues in a sensitive manner and how to manage a case of abuse, a complaint of abuse, suspicions or worries that abuse is occurring. Participants will have better understanding of CAFOD's requirements concerning child protection, CAFOD's own policy and standards and the support that partners can expect from CAFOD. Participants will develop an action plan for their institution during the training that sets out steps to develop their institutional policy via full participation of all staff.
